meanings.definition: Young children, especially those who are mischievous or unruly.
meanings.sent1: The park was filled with rugrats running around and playing.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had a hard time controlling the rugrats during recess.
meanings.sent3: The rugrats decided to have a race to see who could reach the swings first.
meanings.sent4: The rugrats' energy was like a whirlwind, causing chaos wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter echoed through the playground as the rugrats played tag.

meanings.definition: A popular animated television show featuring a group of adventurous babies.
meanings.sent1: My favorite episode of Rugrats is when they go on a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent2: Rugrats was a beloved show that many kids enjoyed watching after school.
meanings.sent3: The Rugrats characters always found themselves in funny situations.
meanings.sent4: Watching Rugrats felt like going on a wild adventure with baby explorers.
meanings.sent5: The theme song of Rugrats always brought a smile to my face.
